page.title: 03THE CHURCH COMMUNITY 1
page.content: The Parish is on the southern boundary of the Diocese of Peterborough, and we share our Rector with Evenley. At present 9.30 Holy Communion services are held on 2nd and 4th Sundays, with Evensong at 6pm on those days; a family service is held at 11am on 1st Sundays, and Matins every 3rd. A Sunday School is held in the WI Hut every Sunday at 11 am. Services are not well attended at present. Churchgoing appears to be a part of village life which has lost its importance. Christmas, Harvest and Easter do attract larger numbers. Bell ringers pull weekly, and practice on Tuesdays. A recent influx of new young ringers from the village has assured the future of the band. There is a five bell peal, last re-cast and re-hung in 1923, after a fire, and there is room for two more.
